title: Gathering data to prove that we can implicitly crowdsource language-related datasets from learners

author: Lionel Nicolas, European Academy of Bozen/Bolzano (EURAC)

segmentation: So I'm going to speak about an initiative we are trying to kickstart with Internet collect.

And so I will present your slides that I prepared with my colleague very not loading, which is about gathering data to prove that we can implicitly, implicitly crowd source language related data set from language learners.
So to do so, I will start with speaking about the objective of this presentation.
Then I will explain a theoretical implicit crowdsourcing model that combines language related data set with language learning and exercise.
I will speak about the type of data set that we want to obtain, which are mostly sets of learner answers to exercise.
And then I will explain the added value in providing the data sets.
And finally I will have three questions for you.
So.
